SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.state

Interface GameState

All Known Implementing Classes:
LevelState, LoseState, MainMenuState, WinState
public interface GameState
Represents a state in the game. Implementations of this interface define specific behaviors and logic for different game states.
See Also:
  • Github Source Code

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    cleanup()
    Cleans up resources or resets settings before transitioning to another state.
    javafx.scene.Scene
    getScene()
    Retrieves the current Scene of the state.
    void
    handleInput(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
    Handles input events specific to the game state.
    void
    initialize()
    Initializes the game state.
    void
    update(long now)
    Updates the game state.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      void initialize()
      Initializes the game state. This method is called when the state is first loaded.

    • update

      void update(long now)
      Updates the game state. This method is called in the game loop to update the state logic.
      Parameters:
      now - The current timestamp in nanoseconds.

    • handleInput

      void handleInput(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles input events specific to the game state.
      Parameters:
      event - The KeyEvent to be processed.

    • cleanup

      void cleanup()
      Cleans up resources or resets settings before transitioning to another state. This method is called when the game state is about to be changed.

    • getScene

      javafx.scene.Scene getScene()
      Retrieves the current Scene of the state.
      Returns:
      The Scene object representing the current state.
